segments.text: Excuse me . Do you think I can get there in time to catch the 11:30 train ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , let me see . Now it's 11:00 sharp . It's a long way to go.If I take the shortest route , we may come across a traffic jam.If I take a less heavy route , it will save us 10 or more minutes , but you'll have to pay more . Which do you prefer ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Are you sure that I can get there in time if we take the less heavy route ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Generally speaking , we can if we go at this speed and nothing unexpected happens .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How much more do I have to pay ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Compared to the shortest route , you may pay around 5 Euro more .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's acceptable . No one wants to miss a train .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: OK ... Here we are . We'll turn left at this cross . To go straight ahead is the shortest route .
segments.speaker: S2
